definition: to cut off/to chop sth in half
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Sometimes we have to do things which are painful, to make our lives better.
sentences.chinese: 有时候必须慧剑斩断情思，才能更好的生活。

sentences.english: And the people shall be as ashes after a fire, as a bundle of thorns they shall be burnt with fire.
sentences.chinese: 万民将被焚烧，有如石灰，又如斩断的荆棘毁于火中。

sentences.english: We must take concerted action and cut his claws .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须齐心合力，斩断他的魔爪。

sentences.english: But it's a Gordian knot, my dear, and it will have to be cut.
sentences.chinese: 但这是个很难解的结，亲爱的，你得一刀斩断它。

definition: to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
at the base/at the root/(of a leg) just below the crutch
to cleave/to split open/to spread open (fingers, legs)
lit. two segments with a single cut (idiom)/fig. to make a clean break (idiom)
(hitting) squarely in the middle/(slicing) across the middle/to hold by the waist
to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
